page.title: 21The next chapter 1986-2011
page.content:
Still living in the same house in Cherry Burton but no longer a seaman. Took the NORLAND to Germany in 87 where she was lenghthened by 23 metres and returned to service between Hull and Zeebrugge. The following year took over as Captain of NORSEA between Hull and Rotterdam. In 1991 I was asked to move ashore and took over as UK Manager of North Sea Ferries based in Hull. The company was taken over by P&O in 1994 and I became UK Director responsible for Teesport, Hull Felixstowe and the British Flag ships. I became a Director of the North of England P&I Club in Newcastle and the Chamber of Shipping in London and chaired the Passenger Ship Issues committee.

Took early retirement after restructuring the company in 2003 when control was passed to P&O Ferries Dover. Did some consultancy work and was hired by the Standard P&I Club in London to report on the Safety Management System being used by BC Ferries in Vancouver.
